metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3220 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 6.1-rc8. dpu_crtc_atomic_check in drivers/gpu/drm/msm/disp/dpu1/dpu_crtc.c lacks check of the return value of kzalloc() and will cause the NULL Pointer Dereference. It was discovered that the Qualcomm MSM DPU driver in the Linux kernel did not properly validate memory allocations in certain situations, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3220` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-18-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
